articles.description: Arsenal goalkeeper David Raya proved his doubters wrong as Gunners progress in Champions League, says BBC Sport's Phil McNulty.
articles.title: Raya delivers when it matters most for Arsenal

articles.description: Barcelona reach the Champions League quarter-finals for the first time in four years with an entertaining victory over Napoli at Estadi de Montjuic.
articles.title: Barcelona see off Napoli to reach quarter-finals

articles.description: It has taken 14 years and three days, but Arsenal are back in the Champions League quarter-finals - with Porto, penalties and a second-leg comeback once again in the script.
articles.title: 'Where we want to be' - Arsenal end 14-year wait

articles.description: England wing Immanuel Feyi-Waboso is ruled out of the Six Nations finale against France on Saturday because of concussion.
articles.title: England's Feyi-Waboso ruled out of Six Nations finale

articles.description: Carlos Alcaraz continues his title defence with a straight-set win against Hungary's Fabian Marozsan to reach the last eight at Indian Wells.
articles.title: Indian Wells: Holder Carlos Alcaraz sweeps aside Fabian Marozsan to reach last eight

articles.description: Al-Hilal, Saudi Arabia's most decorated team, have broken the world record for most consecutive wins by a top-flight side.
articles.title: Al-Hilal set world record with 28th successive win

articles.description: Porto manager Sergio Conceicao accuses Gunners boss Mikel Arteta of "insulting his family" after their thrilling Champions League last-16 tie.
articles.title: Arteta 'insulted my family' claims Porto's Conceicao

articles.description: The politician who chairs the Culture, Media and Sport committee accuses Premier League clubs of making an "empty promise" about a new funding deal for the English Football League.
articles.title: Top-flight clubs accused of 'empty promise' on EFL funding

articles.description: Uefa says there "could be a problem" with ticketless fans for the Europa League final at Dublin's Aviva Stadium.
articles.title: Ticketless fans 'could be problem' at Europa final

articles.description: Pace bowler James Anderson is excited to be part of England's plans in the summer but is not taking his place in the side as a given.
articles.title: I'm not getting any worse - Anderson
